item.title: South-East Asian powers offer strong criticism of US operation in Venezuela

item.title: Victorian Liberal Party deputy leader Sam Groth will exit politics at next election
item.description: Sam Groth, the deputy leader of the Victorian Liberal Party, has announced he will not contest the upcoming state election in November, saying he made his decision after realising that some recent negative public pressure had come from within his own party.

item.title: Tributes flow for founding father of Australian beef industry, Sir Graham McCamley
item.description: From building one of Queensland's most respected cattle empires and championing the Brahman breed, Sir Graham's lifelong dedication to agriculture and his community was truly remarkable.

item.title: Measles alert as Adelaide and Sydney airports among possible exposure sites

item.title: Staff at new Noarlunga mental health unit 'visibly distressed and crying', union says
item.description: South Australia's doctors' union has raised concerns that clinicians were distressed when asked to admit more patients at a new mental health unit at Noarlunga Hospital when staffing levels were "not clinically safe".

item.title: Cosmetic nurse banned for two years after injecting botox without consulting doctor or obtaining prescription
item.description: An AHPRA investigation found Thia Sullivan injected a patient without doctor consultation or a script, falsified records, and urged patients not to co-operate with police.

item.title: Sam Welsford aiming to cap new Ineos-Grenadiers contract with National title in Perth
item.description: Sam Welsford, one of the drawcards at this week's Australian road cycling championships, has thanked fellow sprinter Caleb Ewan for advice on his new contract.

item.title: Ex-CIA agent Aldrich Ames who sold US secrets to the Soviets dies in prison at 84
item.description: Aldrich Ames, who was 84, betrayed Western intelligence assets to the Soviet Union and Russia in one of the most damaging intelligence breaches in US history.

item.title: Beau Webster sparks another English meltdown and Jacob Bethell brings tears — quick hits from day four of the SCG Test
item.description: Beau Webster sparks a classic English meltdown as Jacob Bethell brings tears while Ben Stokes fails to finish another series. Here are your quick hits from day four of the SCG Test.

item.title: Wednesday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Ashes 2026: Jacob Bethell, England's biggest hope and biggest blunder, sets up Sydney finale
item.description: Jacob Bethell's brilliant maiden Test century sets up an intriguing finish in Sydney, but leaves everyone bemused as to where this precocious young player has been all summer.

item.title: Maida Vale, High Wycombe fire extinguished after closing parts of Roe Highway
item.description: Ground and aerial crews successfully control a bushfire that closed a section of Roe Highway and brought traffic to a standstill.

item.title: Nestlé recalls select batches of Alfamino infant formula
item.description: The precautionary measure is over concerns that the product could contain a toxin that can cause food poisoning symptoms.

item.title: Hottest day in years recorded across southern Australia as bushfire warnings remain
item.description: South-east Australia has sweltered through its hottest day in years as firefighters in Victoria continue to battle multiple out-of-control blazes.

item.title: WA police launch search for Kenneth John Giles, 58, after gunshot near Mullewa, woman injured
item.description: A manhunt is underway for 58-year-old Kenneth John Giles who allegedly fled with a firearm after a shooting on a rural property near Mullewa, about 450 kilometres north of Perth, with a woman suffering non-life-threatening injuries.

item.title: US seizes more oil tankers as it lays out three-phase plan for Venezuela
item.description: Russia says one of the Venezuela-linked tankers is "our vessel" and demands the quick release of its citizens, as the US pledges to continue seizing ships and keep the pressure on Venezuela's interim leaders.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis's Brisbane International campaign ends in loss to French duo
item.description: Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis's doubles campaign at the Brisbane International has come to an end after an entertaining tiebreak decider against France.

item.title: Property losses, warnings for bushfires across Victoria as firefighters prepare for 'catastrophic' conditions
item.description: Emergency warnings remain in place as out-of-control blazes continue to burn in Victoria ahead of "catastrophic" fire conditions on Friday.

item.title: Today in History, January 8: 'El Chapo' recaptured in bloody raid
item.description: "Mission accomplished: we got him," began the triumphant tweet from Mexico's then-president Enrique Peña Nieto.

item.title: Heatwave breakdown state-by-state as breeze offers just a brief reprieve
item.description: A breeze will bring a brief reprieve for coastal areas of Victoria and South Australia today before the heat and fire danger ramps up again tomorrow.

item.title: NATO faces unpredictable threat from Donald Trump as US eyes Greenland
item.description: Donald Trump has made it clear he's departing from decades of US foreign policy norms and once-close allies are now questioning what it could mean for them.

item.title: Organiser of Indigenous deaths in custody rally vows to defy NSW protest laws
item.description: Paul Silva says he plans to defy NSW's new protest restrictions to rally against Indigenous deaths in custody.

item.title: Labor fundraiser at centre of Minns donations allegations bigger than official records suggest, newspaper report shows

item.title: Derailed freight train shuts part of key national railway line. Here's what we know

item.title: Should you exercise during hot weather? Experts weigh in as southern states swelter
item.description: Despite parts of Australia experiencing the worst heatwave conditions since the 2019-20 Black Summer, people can still be spotted braving the hot weather to go for a run. Should they be doing this?

item.title: Queensland's far north-east braces for a deluge of rain and possible cyclone
item.description: A tropical low has been declared over the Coral Sea and it is expected to move towards the Far North Queensland coast over the next few days. The bureau said there is a moderate chance it could develop into a tropical cyclone.

item.description: Commercial fishers impacted by a Kimberley marine park say the government has failed to deliver promised compensation.

item.description: After recently struggling for form, Australian star Laura Peel strikes gold at the aerials World Cup event in Canada in her best showing of the season.
